title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @IloveGorgeousGeorge
comment:
Here's a REAL Before You Buy tip: UNLESS YOU ARE AN ALWAYS ONLINE MULTIPLAYER GAMER, this game is functionally useless to you after the 8 hour campaign is over. The meat and potatoes of this game is called Operations, which has a bunch of grinding and class unlocks, and it DOES NOT SAVE PROGRESS if offline. Even if you spend a week grinding and then you GO online, you will lose all of your progress.

This game is a Rent at best, and it boggles my mind that everyone is dick riding it so hard.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @8bitrandomencounter
comment:
My advice for getting into Warhammer is simple: get some miniatures you think are cool, look up some painting tutorials, and listen to an audiobook while you play.

You can also get the Dawn of War games if you want a rundown of what the factions are about. Personally I think that the best factions to get into for painting are Chaos Space Marines and the various Xenos (Especially Tau)!

There are some great sets to get started with like the combat patrols, and, if you decide to go with Chaos Space Marines, I suggest watching a bunch of lore videos about the various Chaos gods and the characters/units associated with them.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @SquareNoggin
comment:
The game is dope, I'm enjoying it, but I have one complaint that applies to nearly all games these days; why don't they ever give cosmetic unlocks for completing the campaign, especially on higher difficulties?

I remember back in Halo 3 you could get the coolest armor by completing the campaign on Legendary, and it was a strong incentive to play the frustrating difficulty levels. 

So I played the campaign on Veteran difficulty and its been good but I've now got stuck at this Carnifex boss - which feels like a f'ng Dark Souls level I'm just constantly dodge rolling and getting merked by combo animations...

When youre on a roll in this game then the combos and combat is smooth and cool, but for a boss like this it gets me very "punch a hole in the wall" because everytime I try to do that lock on target thing that comes after you make a well timed evade the Carnifex gets me. 

Anyways so I'm mulling over restarting the level at a lower difficulty and went to see if theres any unlocks you get for playing the campaign on veteran, and of course there isn't. 

This is _exactly_ the sort of game that would be so well served by giving me some cool cosmetic for struggling through the harder difficulties. But no games ever do that these days... 

It's so lame because it just starts to feel like a waste of time when you get stuck, and the temptation to play on "normal" or whatever is strong. But obviously it would be way more satisfying to succeed at a higher difficulty. 

I've gathered that cosmetic unlocks are a thing in this game, and dressing up your Space Marine to look cool is obviously a very fun part of 40k generally...

It just seems like such an obvious thing that games always fail to do these days. I know part of it is that they want the microtransactions - but it just seems like common sense to reward players for playing the campaign on a higher difficulty. Any little thing that I could put on my marine to show other players in multiplayer "I completed the campaign on X difficulty" would count for so much and would totally motivate people into sinking much more time into the more challenging parts. 

It seems like games these days go one of two ways - either it's Dark Souls / Elden Ring where you have no choice but to play at the punishing difficulty (which obviously turns many people away), or the single player campaign difficulty means absolutely nothing and is entirely present just for your own personal preference. 

I do like the game but in general that whole approach to cosmetics is just gone these days and it makes zero sense to me. A game like this ought to he chalk full of cosmetic unlocks that you can get in a variety of ways. Just take the achievements list and associate all the difficult ones with some piece of Space Marine armor. Obviously there's an absolute ocean or concepts and variationa of Space Marine armor and ways a Space Marine can look, and to let players customize their marine by gunning for specific achievements would be so cool and would make the game highly addictive. 

Maybe they have that in this game, I dunno - but I saw on the wiki that you get 0 unlocks for doing anything in the main campaign and while that's typical these days, it's super lame. 

Surely other people feel the same way?

Because I could sit here dying over and over for another hour until I down this boss - or I could bump the difficulty down, restart the level and breeze through the whole thing. The latter is very unsatisfying but is what I'll likely do, but the former would be super sarisfying and worthwhile _but only if I get some sort of reward for it._ 

An xbox achievement is nothing to me, literally nobody cares about that.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @thepaganpirate3528
comment:
Hey, so huge 40K fan,  I actually play the table top as the Black Templar.  I use their rules rather and I made up my own lore for my army that I named ‚ÄúThe Rising Sons‚Äù 

But to really get into it my go to start is if you like to read, read the Eisenhorne omnibus it‚Äôs the three stories combined.  It‚Äôs more of a detective story since he‚Äôs an Inquisitor.  But it gives you a great overview of the world.  Space Marine stories are so much fun though, but to get into the world start with Eisenhorn that‚Äôs a great way to get what the world is like for Mankind, from there you can read some Guard novels, Rouge Trader stuff Sisters of Battle too! THEN get into the Space Marines.  I‚Äôd also recommend reading some of the different chapters of marines so like Ultramarines, Dark Angels, Blood Angels, Black Templar, Imperial Fists.  Each chapter has their own unique ways of fighting so that will also help out a lot in just seeing how expansive the world is.  May even give you ideas on what you want your armor to look like in multiplayer üòä

If you‚Äôre still hooked then! Start reading the like 54 book series ‚ÄúThe Horus Heresy‚Äù it‚Äôs basically like the prequel Star Wars of 40K it‚Äôs HOW everything became what it became.  It‚Äôs when the Emperor was doing things more, when he was talking to his sons, making laws and such.  But those tales take on more so the Space Marine being the main story characters.  So to get an idea of the world better to start at the low level, work your way up to space marines then read the time of legend so to speak.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy

comment:

This is a game made by developers that actually have a passion for what they created with no other incentive than to give the fans what they wanted.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @jonathanst89
comment:
This was the first Warhammer game I played. It's not my jam. I deleted after 2 missions. Gameplay is boring, combat is repetitive and clunky. Story doesn't do much of anything. The 2 missions I did, gave me 22% completion on the campaign, that's just sad honestly. The menus, and movement system go together pretty well though, limited and discombobulated. 
In between the 2 missions I did, the characters were shocked that something pierced the helmet of a fallen marine, Really? doesn't that happen every second your on the ground with enemies? I just assumed the armor gets pierced constantly seeing as your armor lasts 2 hits then it's straight to your health taken down in 2 more hits. All that nice clean armor, no scratches, no dings. The enemies must have phantom claws, teeth and spikes. I also thought it was really cool that everyone doesn't have to carry around their helmet when not wearing it, it just disappears then reappears like magic. So cool!

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @dskproductions0
comment: They better add more storylines, there's no way they had this major lore/storyline already fabricated for YEARS, Only to have a 7-10hr play time, I was expecting the full WH lore, stories, missions, and cutscenes showcasing the different events. I'm wondering how the devs are going to add more to the game besides what we already have, like said in the video, the game has the foundation but I wanna build my own base, I want to customize my own army and lead set army to attack others, I want the ability to fly my ship all over the galaxy exploring different planets and battling new and unique enemies unlocking different gear. Sadly we will most likely never see this from this game, I'm feeling so much potential but I have such little hope in game devs nowadays. Long story short I feel like this game is just a very small portion of what's truly in the WH lore, and without constant updates and I mean constant this game would get old real quick.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @DRG1244
comment:
Was initially going to be a Day 1 for me (which is really, really rare) but after hearing about longevity (at least right now) I'll be waiting for a price drop. Short campaign and 6 co-op missions isn't what I thought this would be. I was really hoping for a helldivers 2 type situation in relation to PVE. Drop on to various planets/objectives that are randomized and you can level up, unlock gear, weapons, load outs, etc while facing massive hoards/bosses and still keeping things relatively fresh throughout.

Game still looks awesome IMO, just going to wait for a lower price point.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @atcera8714
comment:
Space Marines by lore should be horrifyingly fast compared to their appearance. They have a healing factor, not wolverine healing factor but  definitely way better than Logan healing factor. 
Lore accuracy aside, the perks only give you the illusion of choice, you can take a quick glance and already tell what perks you're gonna want on a lvl 25 character. Armor is trash, stims are hard to find. Heavy is either bugged or the only good class in the game in terms of getting your health back. The customization is cool for sure, with the exception of not being able to change the actual character faces and skins for the more lore purists. They did say that there would be updates for customizations coming. It needs some more time too cook.
What I don't get is why almost everyone is glazing this game up like it doesn't have glaring problems right there to see. Or are we just in a time period where gamers are so gullible that anything that's not complete shit is just a 10/10 game? Call out the problems, make gaming companies care about their game they way they used to. And I'm not saying that just because of this game, there's a huge problem with Black Myth Wukong too, the recommened specs will run the game at like 25 fps, it won't be able to run the benchmark. That was a huge problem but no one called it out, they completely disregarded how lowering recommended specs gets you more downloads, they don't count refunds unless it's a majority.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @cortezandthekillers
comment: The game is fun I had a good time playing it. I think it‚Äôs overpriced, and the lack of depth of the game is offputting based on how much you pay. Case in point it took me eight hours to beat the campaign main campaign. ü§Ø I‚Äôm assuming it‚Äôs going to take roughly half of that time to beat the six secondary missions that allow you to do weapon upgrades, etc. Now I can either play PVE or PVP. I sincerely hope they continue to add to the depth of this game. They have a winning concept here that‚Äôs got a long history & story lines galore. Developers need to give the individual end-user a reason to continue to engage with the product. I think (outside of a couple of months) the popularity of the game is going to quickly die off, and they‚Äôre going to be in helldivers 2 territory. The only difference is helldivers two doesn‚Äôt have the history/story lines that Warhammer 40 K has. If the developers of space marine two can‚Äôt find a way to capitalize on that history, they‚Äôre going to suffer the same fate.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @tiggatar1182
comment: I was really hyped but then found out that there is very few replayability. For me at least... Since the Koop PvE modes Maps arent randomly generated or at least the Objective or where the objective is, i dont have any reason to play it. I get bored pretty easily when things are the same and just replaying these 6 Missions would keep me entertained for 5 to a maximum of 10 hours... Dont get me wrong, the game looks nice and is probably nice, without some kind of replayability through random generated parts, map or objective, im unfortunately not interested. At least not for more than 20$. For me also the pvp mode is completely off, im not a PVP girl but i appreciate that its there for the Players that love it!

comment: If you wanna try 40k there's a sort of mini game version of it called combat patrol. It's probably the most accesible way to start, relatively low cost way to play and get's you actually onto the table top playing a game a little faster so you can see what that's all about. Couldn't recommend it enough, it would defo be where i would point any potential new players to look at. title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @izbreez9615
comment:
I‚Äôm writing this as someone who just refunded space marines on PS5 and spent about 3 hours on it.

Personally the game wasn‚Äôt for me, it‚Äôs very late 2000s or early 2010s shooter game.

No bugs or anything, but I had issues with how the missions were feeling the same, operations is the same as story but with matchmaking, and pvp felt unbalanced.

That being said my biggest issue was the UI, there‚Äôs no dedicated multiplayer menu, you have to manually walk to start multiplayer, changing or equipping classes is cumbersome I mean they made it annoying to really do anything related to your character on top of loading screen galore to exit matchmaking, edit a character, start matchmaking again, switch game modes, idk why they made it so cumbersome.

Anyways game is fine, good game, very pretty but just wasn‚Äôt for me.

Definitely not a helldivers 2 killer, they are two very different games‚Ä¶ if anything this game made me want to boot up helldivers again and I haven‚Äôt touched that in months.

I would compare this closer to world war z

Like a mix of gears of war and world war z

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @Wolfsheim23
comment: I like the gaming environnment of WH40K, but I don't care much for the lore.  I know it's massive, but it's also so seemingly pointless and without direction.  It's all just War War War for the sake of More War. which is perfect for gaming but that is all.  Everything that comes out of it is totally predictable because it all devolves into the same thing.  So it doesn't get me excited because it all retreads the same ground.  It plays out more in the imagination, but that all becomes a blur of the same things too.  Something like Mad Max has more potential I think for creating new believable lore that expands imagination and introduces new ideas that have more weight.

author: @SebastianPistea
comment:
I think this game does not deserve that big price. The campain is very trash:
-Repetitive gameplay
-repetitive enemies
-Corny dialogue
-short campain
-small costumization option 
-classes from multiplayer missing
Some good things:
-sound
-Very good graphics
- Good Multiplayer

Disclaimer: This is the opinion of a newcomer in the Warhammer Universe and I get the hype behind it. I know that for the Universe fans is a big deal, like a fantasy brought to real life. 
Conclusion: This game gives me COD vibes. Like, efortless campaign game, focused only on multiplayer. i hope that they don't screw that part off. But, even with a very good Multiplayer, I don't think that the Game deserves 90 euros.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @addidaswguy
comment:
Man I don't care about Warhammer, I played a few of the games, and they weren't that good, at least to me.

However this one looks soo much like Gears, and it makes me think about CLASSIC Gears, when it was Gears of WAR. No crappy storyline about Mom's, or being a deserter, just badass characters fighting an monstrous army, and you gotta exterminate them all.

I was on the fence the whole time since it's first trailer, but after seeing the gameplay, it makes me really think I'm going to have to get it.  

Also I am sick of games not having couch co-op, or online co-op in campaigns. Games are infinitely better when you can play WITH other people, especially together. At least to me, that stuff is way more fun and memorable than just pvp shooters.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @cej3940
comment:
If you pretended to be a space marine during recess in school, this game is for you lol

Game plays and feels like 2010s games mixed with a Ryse: Son of Rome x Nordic GoW combat system, I'm all here for it too

Customization and unlocks are really reminiscent of Halo Reach (including the grind somewhat)

I'm just a bit upset that the number of classes we have could be halved by making the skill system have different disciplines (like most RPG or a simplified version of that like in Darktide) as the classes come off more like "variations" of a base tactical marine instead of something as distinct as Techmarines, Chaplains, Apothecaries, Librarians etc. 

I think the main 2 that stick out to me are Bulwarks because Emperor's champions and Heavies because of the newer Gravitas plate being basically new terminator armor

They basically took Space Marine 1 and gave it a new coat of paint rather than bending over backward to try to reinvent the wheel

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @tequilawatcher2177
comment: Seen that they won't mention a really important point, I will. Playing the campaign solo on veteran (supposed to be the intended experience according to the game) or above (and some moments in normal)  can get extremley frustrating because of the AI companions, who to be frank, don't help. They donb't change weapons, they don't seem to engage with objectives and will moslty stand around shooting minions while you get attacked by half the tyranid fleet right in front of them. To revive you, one of them will try to get to you, ignoring any enemy and the other guy will just watch him struggle without ever helping.  "Those cokoo banas moments" he mentions become a repetition of stuns, the constant sound of unblocable attacks and spammed enemy barbed wire while you just try to figure out what even is happening.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @armymancommander1
comment: I am a long time warhammer fan this review is baised on me and 2 buddys opinions after playing 8 hours during advanced release. First of all the game was made for console it plays aqwardly on pc. It does not run on HDD so it does have big requiremends for PC my friend had to use his SSD. The campaign is fun but quite shortüòÆ my only complaint is that the animations for cinimatics are lazy. If your a warhammer fan it will also bug you that a normal laz gun is being used as a flamethrower. The PvP multiplayer is exstremely boring 6v6 is way too small and you get stuck on the same map over and over. I played warhamer 40k eternal crusade back in the 2015 era when it was up and this was a significand downgrade from that game. The survival mode is about as good as world war Zs theres just less stuff to use equipment etc. overall of 3 warhammer fans you get 2 "its alrights" and 1 "i want a refund". Understand this game will get more skins via in game currency that you cant pay for (yet) and they will also add more missions from what ive heard not campaign missions but operation missions. Wait out for full release or a sale in my opinion

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @steff-the-ghoul
comment: After playing one evening I have to say it is a good game, but not the timeless masterpiece or best game of the decade everyone had promissed. Graphics are OK, but there is defenitly more to expect in 2024. I mean no Raytracing at all, and in some instances very bad draw distance and no it is not because of my PC, I play with a Ryzen 7 7800x3D and a RTX 4090. But they captured the essence of 40k very good but Games Workshop also has very strict rules about what everything has to look like. Also the difficulty is sometimes balanced very bad, the defend the antenna mission was just awfully frustrating because sometimes you just can't do anything about the unfair amount of enemies they throw at you. I know it is Tyranids but there is always a better way to this than just throw more and more enemies on the player. Overall I like the game, but I think it is more about the fact that I really love warhammer and are painting minis and reading the lore for almost a decade now. At the end it mostly pushes me towards painting my backlog :)

Lowest settings possible, DLSS on ultra performance, capped at 30fps, and still *struggling* to even hold 15-20fps. During heavy combat that bitch is at about 10. As it is now in early release, it is legitimately unplayable.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @allenw794
comment:
Honestly, between this and Darktide, you get a real sense of elites vs. hordes and the atmosphere.
The table top side; not so much. 

But at this point there's the table top, the lore and the video games somewhere in the middle. 

If it's more of the lore try the audio books. There are a LOT of them, but audible sometimes puts them on sale for like $6/7 

Another way to get a taste of other parts are the Battle Reports. Youtube channels that record tabletop games of 40k. Personally I recommend Play on Tabletop. I find Nick's energy infectious. 

The scale can be daunting, but find a part you like and explore bit by bit.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @felipepetersberchielli1651
comment:
If you want to get into 40k there are a good amount of decent games with various genres:

Rogue Trader if you are into CRPGs , made by the same guys who made the Pathfinder games
Mechanicus and Chaosgate: Daemonhunters if you are into XCOM like games, they are similar but different
Battlefleet Gothic Armada 2, it is also a strategy game but this time focusing on ships, the campaing is a bit lame but it has it's high notes
Dawn of War 1 and it's expansions like Dark Crusade if you are into RTS games, a classic
Dawn of War 2 is also a strategy game but hero focused, a good game but in my opinion inferior to the first one
Inquisitor Martyr if you are into Diablo like games
Space hulk deathwing if you like Shooters
Boltgun if you like classic doom like shooters, this one is special because lorewise it is tied to the Space Marine franchise
Gladius:Relics of War, if you like 4X Civilization like games

There are thousands of W40K games, 90% are trash tho but in recent times the quality of their games have been increasing
btw if you like medieval high fantasy there is also the classic Warhammer and a shit ton of games as well

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @ramonosuke
comment:
Everyone is so elated with this game but I will wait due to Saber Interactive‚Äôs track record of abandoning games in less than a year. I get it they have a ‚Äúroadmap‚Äù but so did Anthem. Snow Runner is still full of bugs, yet they kept releasing dlc for it. Evil Dead, barely released content for an ONLINE ONLY game, now it‚Äôs pretty much a ghost town, yet they released a Game of the Year edition. Expeditions did not have coop at launch, and now steam version has it, and it‚Äôs buggy as hell(mode still not out on consoles)

I‚Äôd be all over this game,and I‚Äôm really liking what I see here but Saber makes it really hard to pay the full asking price for their games, after being burned a few times

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @lordazn
comment: As a 40k fan who does the tabletop as much as the gaming, I say do the hobby for the fluff. What I mean by this is rather that worrying over what is the meta or reading datasheets and swapping armies more than your socks, just find a part of the lore you can latch onto or better yet, build your own off of the setting. That opens you to the full setting and makes the hobby so much more exciting and less of a chore, like I have seen with the meta-players. I am not dunking on them, play it however you want, but that is how I've had fun with the hobby.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @Dannyheal
comment:
I've been playing 40k since the mid 90s now. I really wish they went with something other than the Tyranids. I always found them boring, which is the only thing that was keeping me from making this a day one purchase, but I think I am sold, since I enjoyed the first and games like Deathwing, which was criminally overlooked. 
I wish they stuck with Orks or even went Eldar, or just go full Chaos, especially from a writing standpoint. Hell, even Tau.
I can't explain it, but yeah, Tyranids just always seemed like such a generic big bad for an army.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @guyinapandasuit2691
comment:
32 year old Lifelong Warhammer fan here. 

Saying I'm excited is an understatement. I loved the first game. I recently played it again and it aged pretty well. Warhammer games are notoriously mediocre. Some are amazing for a specific few, but overall we don't get many games that truly capture  Warhammer  and what it is. Space Marine 2 is the first Tyranid implementation in a video game that is true to what fighting the nids would actually be like. Considering the bugs were my army when I played the tabletop game, I'm beyond stoked to see them represented in a way I've imagined in my head for years. I can't wait. 



If you guys want to get into Warhammer, there are 2 channels that are great for it. Weshammer is probably the best for new people to 40k. 
Leutin09 is also amazing. He has long form content that can give you months of content to fall asleep to every night if you want. Dudes voice is very soothing lol. He's very informative and covers details usually glossed over in other lore video series. 


Welcome to the coolest universe in all of nerd culture. I genuinely think Warhammer is mind blowing and I hope the Grim Dark is as intriguing to you all as it is to me.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @mellod5224
comment:
I started off by reading the Eisenhorn series and then moved on reading the Gaunt's Ghosts series. These books are amazing and I can't recommend them enough.

From there, I moved on to playing Rogue Traders. It was really cool to meet the different factions that exist within Warhammer. Fun but kind of tedious game. I still loved it.

Also, Isander and Coda is a great WH lore channel for beginners to get into because the videos are just Isander introducing and explaining the lore to his friend, Coda, in a very entertaining way.

title: Space Marine 2 - Before You Buy
author: @chriswriter9087
comment:
If you want to get into Warhammer:

1. On the Game front Dawn of War 1 & 2 for real time strategy & tactics. Boltgun for a classic Doom/Quake style shooter. Mechanicus for an XCOM-Roguelike turn based game.

2. On the books front a great entry point would be the Ciaphas Cain books.

3. On the tabletop front: DO NOT buy GW‚Äôs overpriced plastic crack directly from their web store. Seek out your local hobby shops and see if there is an active modeling & gaming community before dipping your toes in.
